benchmark_details.name: SENSE-7 (Subjective Empathy in Natural Sustained Exchanges)
benchmark_details.overview: SENSE-7 is a human-centered digital empathy dataset comprising 695 annotated real-world conversations between information workers and Large Language Models (LLMs), reflecting user perceptions of empathy including contextual and emotional states.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive understanding of user perceptions of empathy in AI through a human-centered and multi-dimensional framework, facilitating advancements in empathic AI designs.

data.source: Real-world conversations between information workers and LLMs
data.annotation: User-annotated empathy perceptions with per-turn empathy ratings.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on user ratings and feedback across multiple turns of conversation.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate greater perceived empathy as evaluated by users in the conversation context.
methodology.baseline_results: Average Spearman correlation = 0.369, Accuracy = 0.487 over a sample set of 672 conversations.
methodology.validation: Validation was performed through user feedback and statistical tests on empathy ratings.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis on participant demographics including age and gender influence on empathy perceptions.
harm: Misleading users into emotional dependency on AI systems
Insufficient clarity in AI's empathic abilities

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Anonymization procedures were employed to protect user identities and sensitive information.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Participants provided consent for data collection and usage in research.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Study was approved by the Microsoft Research Institutional Review Board.
